newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Zhuzhou Smelter says boosts 97 output plan. [Corrected 09:39 gmt]
newsitem.headline: China Zhuzhou Smelter says boosts 97 output plan. [Corrected 09:39 gmt]

text.p: China's Zhuzhou Smelter said on Tuesday it had decided to increase its annual zinc output to 260,000 tonnes per year in 1997, from its previous target of 210,000 tonnes per year.
In a faxed statement, the smelter said the production increase was mianly due to a 100,000-tonne zinc production line which came onstream last year.
The smelter said it planned to export 160,000 to 180,000 tonnes of zinc and zinc alloys in 1997, an increase of 300 percent compared to 1996 exports.
In the first quarter of this year, Zhuzhou had produced about 59,078 (corrects from "50,078") tonnes of zinc and zinc alloy, a 30 percent increase over the same period last year.
In the first quarter of this year, Zhuzhou exported 40,497 tonnes of zinc and zinc alloy, a 174 percent increase from the same period last year, the statement said.
The smelter planned to ship its surplus zinc metal to London Metal Exchange (LME) warehouses at a rate of about 8,000 to 10,000 tonnes per month, starting in March, it said.
This was because zinc physical markets in Southeast Asia were declining slowly, the statement said.
The smelter was currently running at a capacity of about 900 to 950 tonnes per day of zinc. This figure included the processing of national zinc stocks.
